intro: Lappula brachycentroides, commonly known as the narrow-lobed lappula, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Chenopodiaceae, which includes other salt-tolerant plants. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its small, yellowish flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. The leaves are usually narrow and lobed, giving the plant its common name.
